a.title: Update & Roasts by Marx
a.description:
We're back!
I partly explain why we were even gone in a more casual episode of the show. There's also some exciting news! I hope.

Though they're diminished by the fact that I exported the episode wrong and might have lost some fidelity...

For some actual content, I also read some excerpts of Marx's texts where he critiques other thinkers, including:
Ludwig Feuerbach, Max Stirner, and Mikhail Bakunin.
I have included a convenient file in case you want to get straight to the roasts!

a.title: The Communist Manifesto Discussion
a.description: Episode discussing The Communist Manifesto as a whole, providing some background about Marx, and giving my limited thoughts.

a.title: The Communist Manifesto Part 3
a.description:
We finish up with the (reading part) of The Communist Manifesto. Spoilers: I could not contain my excitement reading the final few sentences, fair warning of a volume increase (up to almost inside voice loudness!!)

Chapters Covered:

3. Socialist and Communist Literature
4. Position of the Communists in Relation to the Various Existing Opposition Parties

a.title: The Communist Manifesto Part 2
a.description:
In the second episode, we continue reading. I believe this is the meat of the Manifesto, so listen carefully (and peacefully). There's a decent definition of what Communism entails, and we even touch on feminism very very briefly.

Drink of the Evening: Adult Grape Juice

Chapters covered: 2. Proletarians and Communists

a.title: Intro & The Communist Manifesto Part 1
a.description:
We start with the booklet that started the show. The first proto-episode was an ASMR reading of The Communist Manifesto on FreshAir 2019 UK Election Special. Due to the limited time slot I was unable to read The Manifesto in its entiriety. However, there is nothing that can stop me now.

Drink of the Evening: Coffee from Caf√© Rebelde Zapatista beans

Chapter covered: 1. Bourgeois And Proletarians
